Database

Interface DBcontrollerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBcontroller

    public interface DBcontrollerInterface
    Interface to declare the methods required, and their signatures, for the project's DB view.
    Version:
    1.0 JavaDoc made under the assumption that the HTML generated doc will include private fields. Under different circumstances, the private attributes would be documented in the public getters, and the rest would link there. Private attributes documentation was made so everything will be documented.
    Author:
    Daniel Menahem 39676804, Michael Shvarts 301578878

    • Method Detail

      • insertEvent

        void insertEvent(java.lang.String playerID,
                 int gameID,
                 int gameScore,
                 GameObjects.EventType event)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Insert an event to the DB.
        Parameters:
        playerID - player's name, string inserted by the user
        gameID - game's ID. To insert, get current number of games and increment it by 1 to avoid collisions
        gameScore - game's score at the moment of the event
        event - event type EventType
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - DB SQL exceptions

        Returns:

      • getCurrentNumberOfGames

        int getCurrentNumberOfGames()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get current number of games.
        Returns:
        number of current games in the DB. New game's ID should be +1 of this number.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - DB SQL exceptions

        Throws:

        java.lang.Exception - Player doesn't exist

      • getAverageScoresOfXTopGameByPlayersWithXGamesOrMoreDescending

        java.util.ArrayList<Record> getAverageScoresOfXTopGameByPlayersWithXGamesOrMoreDescending(int minGames)
                                                                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get the average scores of X top games of players who have at least X number of games, sorted by score, descending.
        Parameters:
        minGames - the minimum number of games of players to show
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Record selected in the DB
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - DB SQL exceptions

      • getAllGamesByMostEventsDescending

        java.util.ArrayList<Record> getAllGamesByMostEventsDescending(GameObjects.EventType event)
                                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get all the games, sorted by number of events of a certain type, descending.
        Parameters:
        event - type of event to count, (EventType END_GAME is not relevant for this query (1 per game))
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Record selected in the DB
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - DB SQL exceptions
